channel.title: Recent & Upcoming Talks on Jean Monlong
channel.description: Recent content in Recent & Upcoming Talks on Jean Monlong

item.title: Genotyping structural variants in pangenome graphs using the vg toolkit
item.description: @JMonlong is presenting genotyping of structural variances in graph genomes using vg. #gi2019 Preprint: https://t.co/7R7JJ0CrCu Code: https://t.co/e6nRfAbGSj pic.twitter.com/te1eVRSysg — Martin Steinegger (@thesteinegger) November 7, 2019 @JMonlong has some beef with the VCF format (lol don't we all!): multiple equivalent representation, over-simplification, impractical; he suggests representations based on mapping directly to the assembly #gi2019 — Daniel Standage (@byuhobbes) November 7, 2019 Nice talk from @JMonlong about SV genotyping using VG @BenedictPaten at #gi2019 .

item.title: Genome variation graphs with the vg toolkit
item.description: #ASHG19 Jean Monlong presenting overview of genome graph rep package vg GRC session pic.twitter.com/TkBWc8lI9v — Chris Boles (@tchrisboles) October 15, 2019 #ASHG19 JM: vg handling large sets of genomes pic.twitter.com/Xo01Dlf6pZ — Chris Boles (@tchrisboles) October 15, 2019 #ASHG19 JM: vg graph viewer pic.twitter.com/EexFptZWnZ — Chris Boles (@tchrisboles) October 15, 2019

item.title: Genotyping structural variants in pangenome graphs using the vg toolkit
item.description: Jean Monlong from @UCSC : Genotyping Structural Variants in Pangenome Graphs Using the VG Toolkit #nccb2019 pic.twitter.com/hjHEzJr6Cj — NCCB Symposium (@NorCalCompBio) October 12, 2019
